Making or breaking a habit takes conscious mental effort and perseverance, but the pay off can be massive. Welcome to EveryDayHabit.
 
Habits are powerful mini auto-pilot scripts that kick in with very specific triggers. They free up our mental capacity by essentially removing the need to make active decisions or to respond to stimuli while the habit script is running. Habits are not only executed automatically, but are also formed automatically, with our brains constantly searching for behavioural patterns to automate in order to optimise our day to day lives. This might make habits hard to break, but luckily makes it fairly straight forward to form new positive habits.


To achieve your ultimate goal will require effort and perseverance, but to establish a relevant micro habit to get you started does not. By breaking the steps down into the simplest possible daily activity that would take very little time and physical effort to complete, habit formation is a walk in the park.


Every habit starts with a trigger. The easiest way to approach the formation of a new habit is to piggyback it on another habitual daily activity. Another option is to use the trigger of a bad habit you want to drop and substitute your new positive habit. If you do this, make sure that the new habit has a similar reward to the bad habit you are replacing.


With EveryDayHabit there are also no Mondays and no first-of-the-months, only the very next day. Your habit starts right now.


There are many great resources out there on habit formation and the powerful impact habits have on our lives, but these are the basics you need to get started. Make it simple, keep the trigger and reward consistent, and do it every day!
